dialogues.speaker: SAFTRIA
dialogues.text: Kahaa—se hai tu? Rahul is trying to wrestle out of Safirini’s grip and his grandmother is also pulling him towards her but Safirni is too strong.

dialogues.speaker: SABIRINI
dialogues.text: Batea_kahaa_sehait

dialogues.speaker: RAHUL KUMAR
dialogues.text: I am an American. I am not an Indian. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RAHUL KUMAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See [fumbling to get the passport out of his pocket] mera passport dekhiye. Safirini has a smile that suggests that he has got the right man. Holding him by his collar, Safirini drags Rahul Kumar from his seat. Rahul resist’s and the grandmother tries to help but to no avail. Safirini holds him by his collar and drags him out.

dialogues.speaker: SUJATA
dialogues.text: Please jaane do usse, mujhe le lo uski jagah, mere bache ko chhod do She is crying out for passengers near them to help her but they don’t want to interfere lest they be taken in his place. Safirini yanks Rahul and drags him towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Amreeka ka yahi rob mitaana hain, tera amreeki passport hi teri maut banega, baith Rahul Kumar is trying to wrestle out of Safirini’s control as other passengers give way as if happy that they are not the ones in his place. He reaches the front door and Neerja goes to plead for Rahul Kumar.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Please aisa mat kijiye. Please, aapko jo chahiye milega. Please ruk jaaiye Safirini pushes her heavily out of his way. He then orders Debina [standing at the door] to open the door. Debina is too scared to react. The passengers are curious about what is going to happen. Rahul begins to feel the dread.

dialogues.speaker: RAHUL
dialogues.text: Please leave me..meri daadi akeli hain, mujhe chhod do. Please dont kill me

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Chup. Bilkul chup. Baith. Safirini forces Rahul Kumar to kneel as he continues to cry. Neerja once again comes in between. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Please inhe chhod dijiye, inhe maar ke kuch nahi hoga Khalil is getting irritated with her pleading. The passengers are just looking at the chaos near the door

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (to Debina) darwaza khol! Debina is paralysed with fear.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: (continuing to plead) Please, please chhod dijiye inhe Just then Khalil holds Neerja’s hair forcing her to scream in pain, makes her kneel down next to Rahul Kumar, points the gun at her head and tells Debina in a calm but menacingly cold manner.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Khol darwaza nahi toh pehle isse maaroonga With trembling hands Debina opens the door. Fear on a still pleading Rahul Kumar and Neerja’s face. She can feel the butt of the gun on the back of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inzamam watches the door half open and sees Rahul Kumar and Neerja kneeling down and Khalil standing behind them with a gun pointed at them. Debina is being held at gunpoint by Safirini. Safirini screams out to Inzamam.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Thirty minute. pilot wapis, humaari bataai jagah le jaano ko tayaar milne chahiye. Sirf thirty minute, bas.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Mujhe thoda aur time do please, tees minute mein kaise...

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Time shuru, adhe ghante ek minute pe pehli laash phek doonga baahar, ek passenger ki Inzamam looks at his watch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Lekin sabse pehlay...yeh seedhi hata do yahaa se. ABHI! They shut the door. Safirini sees Inzamam order the stairvan drivers to get out of there through the window. He watches the stair-van get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inzamam is in the midst of a heated conversation with someone.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: What do you mean your hands are tied. This is a Pan Am plane Goddamnit! Inn passengers ki safety aapki zimmedaari hain. You have take responsibility for these... He reacts to what is being said on the other side, grinds his teeth and throws the receiver away

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Bhen Chodh!
Neerja looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Koi aayega? Tumhe lagta hain kissi ko bheja jaayega, militry aayegi ke police?

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Negotiators - special services se Aate hi honge

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Aur nahi aaye toh?

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Aayenge (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A/83 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Safirini looks at his watch and is frustrated. Khalil is nagging him behind.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Aadha ghanta ho gaya hain, abhi tak kissi ne aana hota toh aa gaya hota

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Sabar kar Khalil

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Sabar kare taaki woh apni miltry tayyar karke plane ko udhaa de?

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Jab tak yeh sab hain, aisa kuch nahi hoga

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Mai keh rahaa hoon sab ko maar do

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Abhi nahi. Khalil gets off his back angrily and walks to his section. He looks at Fahad and Mansoor’s clueless faces.

Inzamam reaches the plane with the jeep. Just then the door of the plane opens. Inzamam can hear the Indian American pleading as Safirini is at the door with him. Neerja is there too. They don’t know what is going to happen next.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Dekho unhe chhod do, unhe iske beech mat laao Safirini looks at Inzamam and then spots local media covering the happenings from the lounge area. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Tumhare liye pilot aa rahe hain, hume thoda waqt do

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Zabaan ke kache nikle tum Mr. Inzamam, hume samjhauta nahi karna, sirf apni baat pe amal chahiye Safirini looks at Khalil and he gets the message. He passes his gun behind both the heads as if deciding which head to shoot first. After choosing for a while the gun stops on Neerja’s head. Rahul Kumar still crying- reactions of the distraught grandmother- Neerja waiting with bated breath reaching out to Jaideep’s letter in her pocket. Suddenly a Gun Shot - blood splatter on Neerja’s face. Debina begins to scream, shocked with the blood splattered on her face as well. Reactions of shocked passengers. Grandmother begins to cry. Khalil and Safirini look at each other nonchalantly.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (to khalil in arabic) Phek de baahar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inzamam is stunned as he continues to stare at the plane door. His POV he hears Safirini shout out.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Yeh teri vajah se hua, humaare bataaye wagt se chalo nahi toh aur har maut ki zimmedaari teri He pushes a body out and slams the door shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debina still in shock as we see Safirini kick the body out of the plane.  86 87 88 89 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close-up of the Rahul Kumar’s body thudding to the floor. From the low-angle of Kumar’s body we see the plane door being closed by Safirini as Inzamam and the two people in the jeep rush towards the dead body. He is heard screaming for an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera closes in on Neerja’s blood splattered face. She is trembling in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalil and Safirini are talking to each other but those voices are muffled to the still kneeling Neerja. Blood splatter on her face. Dazed with the near-death experience and the sight of Rahul Kumar being shot next to her she looks around and sees [POV] Rahul Kumar’s grandmother howling and crying- passengers stunned and there is a deathly silence all around - Khalil is looking excited and Fahad and Mansoor are absorbing his enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inzamam is by the body. He sees Rahul Kumar take his last gasp of breath and die. Inzamam is pained as an ambulance reaches them. Two helpers rush with a stretcher and load the body on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja is still gathering her wits. She looks really scared. She gets up and looks at an ambulance steer away from the tarmac through the open window of the emergency door. Neerja straightens her jacket and skirt, turns around to walk inside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Debina is clearly traumatised as Neerja, stands, grabs a hand towel and a bottle water, wets the towel and dabs Debina’s forehead and face, she repeats. Khalil comes to her and tries to stamp his authority on her. He yanks the towel from her hand and throws it aside

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Hilli kyun? (in arabic) issi ko qatl kar dete toh acha tha Neerja is shaking all over with shock and fear but tries to control that voluntary reaction and angrily glares at him as if now fear is not even and option.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: unse baat karo (she points outside) woh tumharii madad... Khalil slaps her, Neerja is stunned

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Jitna bola, utna kar, ek aur lavz nahi. Shock on Neerja’s blood splattered face. Her nose begins to bleed too. Neerja feels the blood running out and holding her nose, rushes to the toilet and shuts the door before Khalil can stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja shivers as Khalil continuously bangs on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naresh is standing outside continuously knocking on the door.

dialogues.speaker: NARESH
dialogues.text: Come out Lado. kab tak chhup ke baithogi? You have to come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja’s body is in shock and she is shivering as she is sobbing. She can hear her father ask.. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Hausla hume har mushkil se nikal sakta hain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red water runs into the sink as Neerja lifts her wet face and sees herself in the mirror. Her hands are shivering. She has the same expression of fear when faced with a similar situation with Naresh. Her body jerks with fear every time Khalil bangs the door.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Baahar nikal! She washes her face again, angrily scrubbing off the blood splatter on her face.

dialogues.speaker: HARISH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Galat baat na karna..na sehna.. She looks at reflection once again and this time there is {the same] look of resolve on her face.

dialogues.speaker: HARISH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bahadur beta kaun?

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Mai. She takes a deep breath, removes her jacket and opens the door. Khalil looks livid and stops her in her path. Neerja stares back at him and Khalil is enjoying this defiance.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: (soft but assertive) Tumne uss passenger ko maarkar galat kiya hai.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (evil smile on his face) Mere farz ke aage kissi zindagi ki koi keemat nahi, meri bhi nahi. ek Mare sau mare The stare-off continues. Finally Neerja turns her face away, brushes past Khalil to the pantry.  93 94 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja is removing something busily. She looks at the front section where the rest of her colleagues are seated. Neerja begins making tea and coffee and calls Tina.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Tina A scared Tina doesn’t know what to do. Neerja calls her again

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Tina Tina gets up and joins Neerja. Safirini and Khalil look at each other surprised and Safirini goes towards Neerja aggressively and holds her by her arm.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Kya kar rahi ho?

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Jab tak baahar se koi message nahi aata, Saare passengers ko sambhalna mera kaam hain. Mujhe apna kaam karne dijiye please.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Farz ki badi pakki ho

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Woh toh aap bhi hain, farz ke liye hi kar rahe ho na yeh sab Safirini lets go of her arm, they hold each others stare

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Koi bhi hoshiyaari dikhaai, toh agli laash teri phekenge. Safirini taps his gun on her shoulder and walks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja’s father is busy typing an article on the typewriter when he is distracted by Mushtaq Khan- the editor of the newspaper. There are two junior journalists and the secretary inside his cabin. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ KHAN
dialogues.text: (stressed and searching for words) Harish? uhhh..zaraa baat karni thi, do u have a minute?

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: I need to finish this article..baad mein baat kare?

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ KHAN
dialogues.text: Urgent hain Harish Harish looks at the stress on Mushtaq’s face, stops typing and gets up from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Kya baat hai Mushtaq...

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ KHAN
dialogues.text: (interrupting Harish) No No..please sit.. We cannot hear the conversation but it is clear from Mushtaq’s body language that he is hesitatingly breaking the news of the plane’s hijack to Harish. Harish holds on to the table as if the ground beneath his feat has disappeared and then flops on the chair.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KARACHI AIRPORT-LOUNGE OFFICE/ JEEP INTERIOR- DAY
dialogues.text: Inzamam is on the phone with Brigadier TM. Brigadier is being driven in a jeep. He has the pictures of Safirini and Khalil (taken by the photographer on the rooftop) in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: Inzamam Miya, tough times. Airport seal ho gaya?

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Yes Chief. Terrorists Libya se hain

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: Abu Nidal Organization ?

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Yes Chief. they are ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: unki demands kya hain? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Chief woh pilots maang rahe hain, but I have two theories. EK, woh passengers ko tab tak gqaid rakhenge jab tak unke saathiyon ko Palestine ki jail se rihaa na kar diya jaaye aur... He stops, looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: Aur doosri?

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Woh plane to Israel mein crash land karenge, ek missile ki tarah

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: (angrily) Tomorrow they’1ll fly the bloody plane into a building for all you know. stall them, chaar se paanch ghante unhe taalna hi hoga.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: I’‘ll try chief, lekin woh bahut besabar aur nervous sound kar rahe hain. Shukra hain pilots plane se nikal aaye, all thanks to Purser Neerja Bhanot, jisne ain wagt pe pilots ko hijack code bhej diya

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: Great! Humaara ek fauji plane mein pehlay se hi hai. Mai special forces tayyar karwaata hoon. Inzamam hangs up and looks around, everyone is waiting for his command, intent and anxiety crease his face

Some passengers are still holding on to their tea/coffee cups dearly as Neerja and other air-hostesses are collecting the cups from those who have finished their drink. Neerja takes a bin-bag passed by Debina to keep it where they store the trash when she overhears Safirini and Khalil. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch (in arabic) Bahut wagt le rahe hain, aur ek ko qatl kar dete hain

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (points to Neerja) (In arabic) Isko gatl kar dete hain, bahut pareshaan kar ke rakha hain

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Nahi. isko katl nahi karenge, wahi humaare kaam aa rahi hain He points to the other air hostess, frightened and nervous

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Usse keh, sabke passport le aaye, pehle Amrican, phir doosre, samjha Khalil nods and turns, he spots Neerja who looks busy

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Aye, idhar aa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers are all stressed. Khalil smiles teasingly and Neerja, gritting her teeth, and takes the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Hello ladies and gentlemen. apne passports nikal lijiye, unhe ab ikkattha kiya jaayega Hearing this, there is a buzz among the passengers. Some of them begin telling that they don’t have it with them. Some gesturing it is in their over-head bags. Some hesitatingly put their passports over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (screaming out through the buzz) Jiske haath mein hain unse le lo, koi hila toh goli maar denge (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Neerja looks at rows and rows of hands above their head holding their passports. Neerja is sad as she announces..

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Sanjana and Dolly please help collect the passports from zone 3. Neerja tells Tina to help her collect the passports from Khalil’s side while she does it from Safirini’s side. The air-hostess’ are taking the passports from the scared passengers as the terrorists are keeping a close eye on them. Neerja, as she reaches a passenger spots an American passport. Neerja gingerly reaches out to take it and at the same time looks around. She spots that all the terrorists except for Khalil is looking at her. Neerja, a little scared, takes the passport turns her body away and pretending to put the passport in the bag drops it. Quickly kicking the passport below the seat, she moves to the next passenger. Neerja collects more passports and drops a few more American passports and kicks it. The Indian Americans look at her stunned and she gives them a half confident smile as if telling them to keep their expression neutral. Sanjana watches Neerja drop another American passport. Sanjana is scared and looks at Fahad looking at her. Neerja takes a passport and hides it in her uniform jacket. Neerja spots Sanjana looking at her scared and gets back to collecting the passports. Sanjana too with quivering hands hides a couple of American passports. Debina is too scared to try the stunt and with her head bowed puts every passport she collects in the bag and so does Tina Sanjana tries to hide another passport but it falls from her hand to the floor. Neerja by this time has reached Sanjana. Neerja turns around to see Khalil watching them and as the passenger [whose passport it is] bends to pick it up, Neerja stops him.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: It's ok Sir. I’ve got it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Neerja bends to pick the passport, she flicks it below the seats and pretends to put her hand in the bag. Sanjana is stunned at Neerja’s blatant bravado as both of them walk towards Safirini. Tina, Debina, Sanjana and Neerja are near Safirini and Khalil now as Safirini takes the bags from all of them. They are about to peer inside to pick American passports when a man sitting in front gets up from his seat and walks towards Safirini and Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (pointing his gun) Marna hain? Baith jaa

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (scared) Sir please, mujhe diabetes hain, mujhe toilet use karne dijiye

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (holding the man by his collar) Wapis jaa He points his gun to his chest, The passengers, who were coming to terms with their situation so far, have begun panicking again. Safirini on the other hand is peering through the bags and is getting frustrated. He throws one bag and takes another. Sanjana looks scared along with Tina and Debina as they watch Neerja.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Naam kya hain? Neerja is slowly removing the passports in her jacket and drops it to the floor and kicks it inside.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Naam!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Akram Baig. Khalil looks at the Man and everyone is stunned not knowing what is going to happen next. Khalil stares for a couple of seconds and lets go of the man’s collar.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Allah ka shukr kar, bacha liya tujhe, jaa ! The man is relieved at being set free and is allowed to go to the toilet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Khalil watches Neerja straighten her jacket as Safirini looks angrily at the air-hostess and Safirini.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Issmein koi bhi American passport nahi hai.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Yeh. kaise ho sakta hain. Safirini looks at the scared airhostess and so does Khalil. Khalil goes towards the (huddling in fear) Tina, Debina, Sanjana and Neerja. He pulls Tina towards him and frisks her from top to bottom. He does the same with Debina and with Sanjana Neerja hides her fear as Khalil looks at her suspiciously and angry. Safirini too is surprised. Khalil moves menacingly towards her but Neerja stands her ground.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: American passport? Where?

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: I ...I dont know, maine sab se passport liye hain, dekho

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Agar koi hoshiyaari dikhai.. Neerja stands there as Khalil hangs the gun on his shoulder and begins frisking Neerja. Neerja spots one passport slightly in view just close to where Khalil is standing. Khalil’s touch is clearly much more than frisking but Neerja’s eyes are fixed on that passport. A man, next to where the frisking is happening, looks at Neerja and looks below his seat. Understanding what she is worried about, he slowly kicks the passport further inside. Neerja is relieved as Khalil finishes frisking. He looks at her as if enjoying her helplessness.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Hatt peeche He gives Khalil a warning glare

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (to safirini) (in arabic) Mai check kar rahaa tha ke kuch chupaya toh nahi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (picking up a brit passport) (in arabic) UK ka passport laa, sab dhokebaaz hain humaare khilaaf mile hue hain {opens the passport and announces loudly] Ronnie Heston. (in urdu) Ronnie Heston kaun hain All the passengers look around to see who is going to be the next sacrificial lamb. A hippy looking man is nervously trying to hide himself.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (screaming out loud) Kaun hain Ronnie Heston! The hippy man nervously gets up from the window side of the seat and shaking nervously he gets out and trudges towards Khalil and Safirini passing Neerja and Akram Baig who just got out of the toilet and was walking to his seat. Khalil jolts him from his slow-pace by holding him by his collar and forcibly makes him kneel down and places the gun to the back of his head. Heston begins panicking and mumbling a prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. NEERJA’S HOUSE- LIVING ROOM - DAY Rama, staring out of a window and lost in thought is fidgeting with Neerja’s ring that she has now worn on her finger. The land line rings and she quickly picks the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Main bol raha hoon.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: (partially relieved) Acha hua aap ka phone aa gaya, badi ghabrahat si ho rahi thi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: (not sure how to say it) Rama woh... Neerja ka plane Karachi ruka tha na..wahaan..plane hijack ho gaya hain. Before Rama can register what she has just heard, Tipsy acts out of character and is uneasily tugging at Rama’s salwar. Rama tries to pacify Tipsy but he won’t rest easy.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: (not believing her ears) Kya ho gaya hain?

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Hijack, kuch terrorists ne plane kabze mein kiya hua hain Rama is stunned speechless. The news begins to slowly sink and tears begin to well up as she looks at the ring in her hand. Tipsy continues to tug Rama’s salwar.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KARACHI AIRPORT/LOUNGE OFFICE- DAY
dialogues.text: Karachi - 12:30 PM Inzamam is very agitated as he is talking to Pan-Am officials on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: How can you not send me pilots, this is your plane, usme baithe passengers aapki zimmedaari hain, Just then a man enters holding a lunch tiffin in his hands. Inzamam doesn’t pay any attention as the man places the tiffin on the table and stands by the door looking at Inzamam shout on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is your Airport. This is your responsibility. We cannot risk our crew for this.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: And the air hostesses? They are your crew (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the plane is in your airport, the breach has been of your security. We cannot risk two more lives. Inzamam angrily bangs the phone. Everyone else in the room is silent. Inzamam breathes hard and then looks at the scared looking man.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Janaab, aapke ghar se phone aaya tha, bhabi ne khaane khaate hi phone karne ko kahaa hain, woh jaana chahti hain aapko saalan pasand aaya ke nahi Inzamam just glares at the man and watches him quickly exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heston is continuing to pray as Safirini and Khalil are talking with each other. The passengers are drained out of energy and have almost given in to their fate. Neerja, Sanjana, Debina and Tina are seen offering water to passengers. Neerja is smiling and reassuring her passengers that everything will be alright. One of the 3 kids - Jatin sitting near the window is innocently playing with a window shade pulling it up and down. Fahad notices this and goes to the child

dialogues.speaker: FAHAD
dialogues.text: Aye, seedhe baith, khidki (he shakes his gun to gesture no) Fahad pushes his gun forward to point to the window, Jatin stops and is fascinated with the gun that Fahad is holding. He reaches out to touch it and Fahad lets him. Just then Neerja spots him and rushes towards the kids and looking at Fahad as if reprimanding him for allowing a kid to toy with a gun. She gives them water to drink. Khalil approaches Safirini

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (to Safirini) (in arabic) Bahut intezaar ho gaya bhai, chaliye, ab maar do iss angrez ko (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He points to Heston. Safirini nods Heston begins to pray louder as Safirini slowly opens to door only to see Inzamam approaching in his jeep together with a few security vehicles along side. Safirini quickly half shuts the door and begins shouting at Inzamam whose vehicle has now reached the plane.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (screaming out at Inzamam apni security ko wapis bhej, nahi toh iss poore plane ko udhaane ka barood hain humaare paas. wapis bhej de apni fauj

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Ok Ok, mai bhej rahaa hoon He turns and motions for the surrounding jeeps to stop and turn away, he turns back to the plane and speaks into a microphone

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Jaisa tum kahoge waisa hi hoga.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: pilot kahaa hain?

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: French crew ke pilot pahuch rahe hain, airport seal karwa diya gaya hain issiliye pahuchne mein ...

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Pilot bhej nahi toh mai laash bhejta hoon. hume plane ka radio operator chahiye, issi wagt..nai toh..

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Haan haan mai kuch karta hoon..abhi kissi ko... Just then the person sitting next to Inzamam interrupts him and gives him some information. Safirini is watching what they are talking.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: (mumbles to his colleague)are you sure? (he turns) Plane mein ek radio engineer hain, Imran Ali. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Safirini looks angrily at Khalil and he to him and then towards the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Imran Ali kaun hain? Safirini shuts the door as Khalil once again barks.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (louder) Imran Ali kaun hain! Neerja looks scared towards Imran Ali who gets up from the place he was sitting in. Fahad and Mansoor [who are near him] look angrily at him and hit him a couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: FAHAD
dialogues.text: Haraamzaade, (in Arabic) pehle jab humne kahaa toh khadaa kyun hai hua Fahad hits him again and pushes him towards Safirini and Khalil. He slowly walks towards them and Neerja is looking concerned. Khalil is about to angrily walk towards him when Safirini stops him.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Bas. Chhod de usko, usse kaam bhi karwana hain Imran Ali stands in front of the terrorists and Safirini is angrily glaring at him.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Mansoor, [Signals Fahad to man that area alone and then to Khalil] mai isse upar leke jaa rahaa hoon tu yahaa dhyaan se sambhaal[and looking around he grabs Debina by her arms] Safirini then orders Imran Ali to walks upstairs and pushes a crying Debina towards the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safirini looks at his watch and it shows 4:00 PM. Debina is sitting in a corner scared as Imran Ali is trying to calm her down. Safirini removes the belt from under his kurta as he tell tells Imran Ali to operate the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Debina is scared further when she sees the belt laden with explosives. Safirini gently keeps it on one side as Inzamam comes on line.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: (on the radio) Pan Am ek french crew ko tayyar kar rahaa hain

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Kitni der mein?

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Bas kuch hi der, tab take passengers mein se kam se kam aurtien aur bache toh chhod do.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Tum waqt batao. Pilots jaldi aaye toh hum tumhari baat par amal karne ki sochenge

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Mai poori koshish kar rahaa hoon, airport bandh hai issiliye unhe aane mein thoda waqt lag sakta hain

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Waqt nahi hain Inzemam. angrezi samajhne waali crew bhej jaldi.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Tum aurtein aur bache bhejoge?

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Sochenge. Safirini cuts the radio contact. INT. NEERJA’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM- DAY A sad looking Aneesh is sitting with his hand on his teary eyed Rama as she is on the phone with Harish. It is as if Tipsy knows the situation too and is sadly sitting by Rama’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Negotiations chal rahi hain Rama, abhi itna hi pataa chal hain yahaa se (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Haan toh woh pehle bache aur aurton ko hi nikaalenge na? Yeh poocha ke nahi?

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Rama jaise hi kuch pataa chalega mai bataata hoon

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Jab hijack training kar ke aayi thi, toh maine pehle hi bol diya tha, chadd pare training, koi danger ho toh pehle apni jaan bachaa ke bhaagna, lekin yeh ladki sunti kahaa hain meri... She wipes her tears

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Rama I hope humaari Lado ko.. Rama reacts

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Kya matbal I hope! mai yakeen se keh sakti hoon Lado theek hain, koi koshish bhi kar ke dekhe meri beti ko kuch karne ki, do beto ki maa hoon Harish ji, phir bhi beti ke liye mannate maangti rahi, uske paida hone pe hum dono ki jaan ko khatra tha. Tha ke nahi? Lekin maine haar nahi maani, na usne. Lado mere sapno se bani hain, mere dil ka tukda hain woh, mera wajood hain usse. Koi usse haath lagaa ke dekhe mai unna diyaa...

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Rama please relax, tumhara BP Rama takes a deep breath

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: 100% usne mere paas wapis aana hain usne apna birthday gift chahiye usse, mai uski tayyari karti hoon (she controls her emotion) bilkul wapis aayegi lado Rama wipes her tears and hangs up

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Aneesh mai zaraa bazaar hoke aayi, Lado ka peela suit laana hain. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Usko wohi waala chahiye birthday pe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debina and Imran Ali are sitting in the Business class seats. With fear writ large on their faces they watch Safirini furiously pace up and down. He suddenly barks at them with his gun pointed at them

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Shutter bandh karo! Jaldi! Imran Ali and Debina get up nervously and do as they are told. Safirini is watching them closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalil is keeping an eye on the passengers a little ahead of the galley. He looks frustrated. Mansoor looks at (a half kneeling) Heston who is mumbling some prayer. He crouches next to him and touches the barrel of his gun to his head. Heston is startled and scared.

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: Biwi bache hain ke apne liye hi duaayen maange jaa rahaa hain ?

dialogues.speaker: HESTON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: Do you have biwi? wife?

dialogues.speaker: HESTON
dialogues.text: Uhhh. .no.. Mansoor shakes his head in disdain

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: Tum angrezon ko shaadi karne mein pataa nahi kya tagqleef hain

dialogues.speaker: HESTON
dialogues.text: I..I have a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: Girlfriend? waah! Waise teri umar bache paida karne ki lagti hain (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Heston is trying desperately to understand what Mansoor is saying, he tries his luck

dialogues.speaker: HESTON
dialogues.text: You have? A girlfriend? Mansoor tightens the grip on his gun, quickly looks around to confirm no-one is looking at him, then smiles sadly

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: no, Humaari bhi badi khwahish thi, kissi pe jaan qurbaan karne ki... lekin tumhare mulkon ne saara khel bigaad diya...(his tone changes suddenly) Ab jaa rahe unhe bachaane jo humaare liye qurbaani deke, jail mein hain. Heston can only follow the English words, he tries to nod

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: Wahaan yeh plane foooosh! He makes an explosion sound, Heston reacts. Mansoor is brought to attention by a screaming Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Aye kutte, teri himmat kaise hui isse baat karne ki

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Nai Mai toh bas pooch rahaa tha...

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Khada ho Just then Neerja brings a crying Jatin and the two young girls through the aisle. Khalil looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Aye, stop! yahaan kaise aaye?

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: bacha hain! toilet use karna hain, insaniat thodi toh bachi hogi tum logo mein?

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Insaniyat? Huh! He points with his gun gesturing them to go back (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Rok lo apne haath, inn sab ko Maarne se, khud marne se tumhare mare hue, bichde hue wapis nahi aayenge. Neerja folds her hands earnestly, Khalil looks at those innocent children and then angrily at Neerja. Mansoor speaks up

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Jaane do unko, mai dhyaan rakhoonga

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Kya matlab Jaane doon!

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) bache hain...

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Tere bache hain?

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) bhai chote bache hain, itna toh hum kar sakte hain, apne aap pe kaabu rakhiye Before Mansoor can complete his sentence, Khalil slaps him causing Mansoor to reel and fall down. Mansoor is stunned and finds an angry Khalil standing on top of him with his gun pointed at his. The passengers who were quiet because of exhaustion begin to scream and panic. Jatin is stifling his cries as Neerja is protecting him from the fracas.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Kaabu mein tu reh, tu mujhe sikhaayega?

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (screaming) Aye Ladko Khalil turns to see Safirini getting down the spiral dragging Imran and Debina with him (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Yahaan kya ho rahaa hain, tum log ladh rahe ho aapas mein Mansoor pushes the gun from his face and gets up on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (holding Khalil’s collar) (in arabic) Iss tarah karoge toh yeh passengers humaare sar pe chadh jaayenge. Akal kahaa hai teri Khalil is angry for being reprimanded and looks angrily at Mansoor. Neerja is hoping that Khalil doesn’t do anything untoward. Realizing that Jatin is sobbing hard she looks at him only to discover that he has peed in his pant. Neerja feels bad for Jatin and using some tissues wipes his pants while pacifying him that this will all be over soon. Khalil still fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalil is staring at Mansoor as Mansoor, ignoring those stares, looks ahead of him. Heston is half kneeling and leaning on the side partition. Sweta is pacifying her crying cousin Jatin. Tina, Sanjana and the other airhostess sitting in the front section look exhausted. Neerja is watching Jatin cry from where she is sitting and looks tired too. Rama is staring blankly ahead of her and petting tipsy. Akhil is by the stairs smoking and Aneesh is sitting next on one of the steps. Harish Bhanot quietly staring at the glass wall in front of him.  107 84
Safirini is negotiating with Inzamam holding Debina at gunpoint in front of him. Inzamam is watching him from the ATC tower using a binocular.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Hum ek ek ko khatam kar denge, kissi ka lihaz nahi hoga, na aurtein na bache na buzurg,

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: mai khud intezar kar rahaa hoon, Pan Am Pakistani airline nahi hain...

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (In arabic) Hum Bavakoof ban rahe hain Safirini is surprised to see Khalil standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Tu yahaan kya kar rahaa hain? Issi waqt neeche

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello? Khalil is still standing there defiantly almost glaring at Safirini.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (warning) Khalil Inzamam writes Khalil on a piece of paper and throws it to one the officers standing by who rushes away for more details

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Please mujhse baat kijiye,

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Tu neeche jaa, Mujhe pataa hain mere kaam

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Tujhe kuch pataa hain! (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: ab tak hum Cyprus pahuch chuke hote, lekin Dus ghante se jhak maar rahe hain yahaa!

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Neeche jaa, jaisa maine kahaa hain waisa kar, samjha Before Safirini can complete his sentence, Khalil aims his gun at Imran Ali and shoots him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone below has heard the gunshot. All of them look scared. Neerja is stunned too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inzamam lowers his binocular and sits down heavily on a chair. Pain and disappointment clear on his face. Through the radio he can hear Safirini reprimand Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalil is watching blood ooze out of a dead Imran Ali's head.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Khalil! goli kyun chalaayi? Khalil doesn’t reply as he snatches the radio from Safirini’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Ab agar pilots nahi aaye, toh ek ek ka yahi hashr hoga. Khalil walks out of the cockpit as Debina is crying next to Imran Ali’s body.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (To Safirini) (in arabic) karte raho baat.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PLANE- DAY
dialogues.text: Everyone in the plane is sweating and some of them are gasping for breath. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Neerja opens the pantry and is searching for water bottles but they are very few bottles remaining. Khalil gets down from the spiral staircase and looks at everybody looking at him with dread in their eyes. He is taken over by blood-lust.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Radio engineer ko yahaan (he points to his forhead) goli maar di Fahad and Mansoor suddenly get anxious again and are on tenterhooks. Fahad is enjoying Khalil’s antic but Mansoor looks concerned. Khalil is smiling almost looking demented when he takes a grenade out from his pocket and begins showing them in a few passengers faces.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Goliyaan bhi hain aur barood bhi. My choice The mental trauma of being stuck in such a situation, their inevitable fate in front of them and no hope in sight, the passengers begin to tiredly cry.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Thodi der aur... Khalil is enjoying the sight. He takes the grenade and shoves it in front of a few passengers and they begin to panic but Khalil seems to be deriving pleasure out of it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KARACHI AIRPORT/HANGAR AREA- DAY
dialogues.text: Brigadier TM is surrounded by military personnel around a table as Inzamam enters.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: Inzamam Miya, bahut bura hua, I just heard about Imran Ali.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Sir maine aapko pehle hi bataaya tha, they are nervous, unke actions predict karna mushkil hota jaa rahaa hain (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Ab stall karne ka waqt khatm ho rahaa hain, yeh kissi bhi waqt passengers ko maarna shuru kar sakte hain. Brigadier nods and begins taking them through the plan for a break-in. Pointing at the blueprint of the airport and runway he is ordering group of people at a time about their positions and movements. Everyone around him is all ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A press-conference is on and a spokesperson is addressing a group of journalists.

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESPERSON
dialogues.text: Hume poori ummeed hain ke haalaat jald hi humaare kaabu mein aa jaayega

dialogues.speaker: JOURNALIST
dialogues.text: Terrorists ki demand kya hain? Kya aap unhe mulk se jaane denge?

dialogues.speaker: SPOKESPERSON
dialogues.text: Dekhiye iss wagt hum sirf itna bataa sakte hain ke terrorists Libya se hain, unka India ya Pakistan se koi talug nahi hain, issiliye unhone ne American airline Hijack ki hain. Hum sirf passengers ki salaamati chahte hain, aur ussi ki tayyari mein hain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/u of Neerja as she looks towards the aisle where Khalil [sweat-soaked and bare-bodied] is getting frustrated and is roaming around the little space that he has. It is clear that he is waiting for something to happen. Heston [who was kneeling all this while] is tiredly sitting and Neerja offers him a whatever little water there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safirini is looking out of the glass. He looks really angry.  116 117 118 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commandoes are getting dressed for action. Shots of them arming their guns, wearing their security cover almost getting ready for battle. Inzamam wears a bullet- proof vest as well together with Brigadier TM. INT. NEERJA’S HOUSE - DAY Rama completely drained out of energy, is sitting holding the phone and talking to Harish.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Meri Laado nikli plane mein se? Maine uska gift khareed liya hain, kitta khush hogi dekh ke.

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Abhi nahi Rama, lekin khabar mili hain ke negotiations chal rahi hain, God willing sab theek ho jaayega

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Tussi wi zyaada tension na lena, Apne dawai khaayi blood pressure waali?

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Tumne khaayi? Both of them are silent as the answer is obviously the same between- NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers are completely fatigued, hungry and parched. Suddenly one senior woman [maybe Rahul Kumar's grandmother] begins to palpitate. She blacks out and falls down limp to the side of her seat. The passengers around panic for help. Sanjana immediately rushes the woman’s aid. Fahad [near whom this is happening] doesn’t know what to do. He is brandishing his gun and screaming out to everybody to stay still. Sanjana doesn’t care and reaches out to the old lady and begins administering CPR and in panic mode calls out to Neerja.

dialogues.speaker: SANJANA
dialogues.text: Neerja, oxygen!! Neerja quickly goes towards the business class and Tina joins her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She bends down to open the hatch on the floor when Khalil who was behind them stamps on the hatch and shuts it close.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Koi darwaza nahi khulega

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Plane mein oxygen kam ho rahaa hain, woh aurat mar sakti hain

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Toh mar jaaye.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: please mujhe unki madad karne do. Khalil points his gun at her.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Chal hat! Neerja pushed away, looks at Tina and her expression suggests that they should listen to Khalil. The silence in the plane is at a flash-point. SUDDENLY the alarm inside begins to ring. Khalil panics and Mansoors jolt to attention too.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (panicking) Kisne bajaaya alarm! Neerja rushes back to him

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: (trying to calm him down ) Please ruk jaao yeh alarm... Khalil pushes the gun into her cheek

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (angrily) pehle tune darwaza khola ab alarm baj gaya hain , tu miltry ko signal dene ki koshish kar rahi hain?

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: (calmly) Alarm toilet mein baj rahaa hain Khalil turns, looks towards the toilet, the sound does seem to be emanating from there (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He pushes Neerja towards the toilet, Tina spotting the chance opens the hatch and takes the oxygen tank out of the hatch and goes in their direction. Neerja opens the toilet and there Fahad is urinating with a cigarette in his mouth. Khalil slaps Fahad at the back of his head, the cigarette drops in the pot. Neerja turns off the alarm During this time Tina has reached Sanjana and has given her the oxygen and the woman is now breathing a little easy. Khalil looks at Sanjana and Tina angrily, goes towards the business class and sees the hatch shut and comes out to where the passengers are and talks to Mansoor.

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Zaleel ho chuke hain, ab humaare saamne sirf maut hain, pilot nahi aane waale

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (screaming at the top of his lungs) (in arabic) Unke baap bhi aayenge humaari tadbeer kaamyaab hogi, poori duniya aaj ka din yaad rakhegi The passengers sitting near them cower and hold on to each other for whatever little illusion of security or safety that comes from it. Neerja looks very concerned and looks at Jatin and the girls crying in fear as well. Neerja walks up to them.

dialogues.speaker: BHAVIK
dialogues.text: Mamma ke paas jaana hain

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Mujhe bhi

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. NEERJA’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - DAY Aneesh, Akhil, Harish and Neerja are sitting at the dining table, lunch is under way there is butter chicken, dal, fried potatoes. Akhil serves himself (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANEESH
dialogues.text: Bhaiya aap humesha leg piece le lete ho

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: Do taange hoti hain murge ki, mar mat, doosra tu le le Neerja smiles, she seems disinterested in food.

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Neerja ko aloo paas kar, garam paronthi laa rahi hain mummy beta Neerja serves herself a few pieces of potato Rama appears with casserole, she serves everyone a paronthi, Neerja refuses as she munches on the potatoes

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Arre ek toh khaani padhegi.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Mamma mera mann nahi hain

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Toh kya khaane ka mann hain, chal kal tu aur mai Sharma Aunty se chowmien banaani seekhe? Thoda bhaut banaana seekh legi na raje toh wapis jaa ke kam problem hogi Neerja and Harish exchange a look

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: Sawaal hi paida hota ke yeh wapis jaayegi, Papa?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Toh mai kaunsa kal bhej rahi hoon usse wapis ! She sits down and serves herself, everyone eats in silence for a few moments

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Dal pass karna Aneesh passes the bowl to Harish

dialogues.speaker: ANEESH
dialogues.text: Papa waise thodi moulding toh karni padhegi Lado ko Akhil gives him a look (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANEESH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nai mai yeh ni keh rahaa ke usne nahi ki, lekin thodi aur karke dekhe toh...

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: Kya kar ke dekhe?

dialogues.speaker: ANEESH
dialogues.text: (slightly nervous under Akhil’s stare) Bhaiya woh..moulding...

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: Khana kha tu chup kar ke

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Arre theek toh keh rahaa hain? Lado aise itni jaldi thode na give up karte hain? itti jaldi itni badi choice. bache adjustment humesha girls ko zyaada karni padhti hain, sab karte hain... sab koi tere papa jaise ni ho sakte, koi koi Akhil jaise bhi hota hain She chuckles trying to lighten the moment, but is unsuccessful, she looks at Harish, he shakes his head, his eyes full of remorse, Neerja observes the exchange. Rama turns to Neerja not wanting to let go of the opportunity to discuss this

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beta mai Naresh se baat karoongi usse samjhaaoongi

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Baad mein kare yeh sab discuss

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Mahina ho gaya hai, baad mein - baad mein karte Harish ji, itni jaldi koi shaadi pe give up karta hain? Now everyone starts talking together, Akhil, Aneesh, Harish Rama as Neerja watches

dialogues.speaker: ANEESH
dialogues.text: Mamma sahi keh rahi hain bhaiya

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: Maine uski taange todh deni hain, haal dekha tha lado ka jab aayi thi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Akhil aise ni bolte beta, Harish ji meri baat samjho

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Rama tumhe pataa nahi ke kya kya hua hain

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Kya pataa nahi hain, mereko sab pataa hain Neerja gets up, everyone stops talking, she walks to a chest of drawers in the corner of the room. She stops and looks at Harish, they have a moment of silent decision making. Harish walks up to her, removes a small key from the lower drawer and hands it Neerja, she opens the drawer and pulls out a file it is neatly labelled ‘NARESH CORRESPONDENCE’ She brings the files to the table, flips through it and starts reading excerpts

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Papa ko kai mahino se letters bhej rahe the Naresh...(she skims as she reads bits and pieces) Mujhe yeh bilkul pasand nahi ke aap baar baar apni beti ko phone karte rehte hain, Aapki beti se shaadi karna waste tha, usse koi kaam nahi aata, koi izzatdaar baap apni beti se kabhie modelling nahi karwaayega, agar aapne Neerja ko phir Bombay bulaaya toh usse wapis bhejne ki koi zaroorat nahi hain. She turns to her mother Rama looks at Harish, she has obviously never heard or seen these letters before. She walks up to him

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Lado ne manaa kiya tha tumhe bataane se Neerja continues reading

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: (continues ) Mai iss shaadi se khush nahi hoon, Neerja is of no use to me... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Agar usse khana banaana nahi aata toh khana khaane ki bhi koi zaroorat nahi hain...aapki beti ko Ghar ka kaam, saaf safai, kuch nahi aata, yeh sab uska kaam hain, She turns to her mother

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Mamma mujhse jo hua maine sab kiya, jhadhu maara, bartan dhoye, kapde dhoye, uski maid ban gayi thi mai mamma, aur phir bhi dekho aur kya likha hain (she continues) koi gareeb aadmi bhi apni beti ko shaadi mein kuch de deta hain, aap ne Neerja ko khaali haath bhej diya

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: What rubbish, papa ne clear bol diya tha ke hum dowry ke bilkul against hain. Aur Naresh ne agree kiya tha.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Mamma maine sab kuch kiya, mujhe ghar mein kaam ke alawa kuch allowed hi nahi tha, music system ko haath lagaane ki bhi permission nahi thi. Jab mai aayi thi toh jo mere sar pe chot thi, woh girne se nahi lagi thi mamma, mai clumsy nahi hoon mamma aapko pataa hain na? EK paisa nahi tha mere haath mein, aapko pataa bhi hain mai kaise aap ko phone karti thi? Neerja’s voice breaks at the memory, Rama rushes to her daughter, she takes the file from her and throws it aside and hugs her daughter tight. Neerja rests her head on her mother’s shoulder

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mai marne se pehle marna nahi chahti Babumoshai

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Maine kai ni jaane dena tereko. Rama weeps for her daughters pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja sadly smiles at the kids.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Thodi der aur, be strong please, uske baad Tum aur mai dono apni mamma ke paas jaayenge, aur jab woh hume zor se hug karengi toh hum bhool jaayenge yeh sab, I promise. The children nod their head and wipe their tears. MAMA SONG CONTINUES. INT. NEERJA’S HOUSE- EVENING Rama stands by the balcony looking out, her face full of worry thinking about her daughter.She looks below at the compound and sees three school children,about 6 to 7 years of age,being taken home by their mothers.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSITION TO
dialogues.text: INT. NEERJA’S HOUSE- BEDROOM - EVENING Rama goes to Neerja’s room and sits heavily on the bed. She looks at the wall and thinks about Neerja. She cleans up and organises Neerja's room. She settles her stuffed toy on her bed and then begins ironing her clothes. She moves towards one of Neerja’s cupboards and removes a file/album from inside. The album has portfolio pictures and her modelling assignment pictures. Rama then looks at one of the corners in the room and spots a pile of magazines. She picks one of the magazines and flips the pages till she reaches a full page ad featuring a smiling Neerja. Rama then picks the whole pile of magazines and sits on the bed with a pair of scissors and is cutting Neerja’s pictures and lovingly pasting them in the album. As the song continues, Rama is done with all the Magazines as they lie tattered on the bed. She sits for a while with concern on her face and spots a shopping bag on the bed. She reaches out to the bag and from there removes the yellow dupatta and starts gift-wrapping it. Mother picks the gift wrapped dupatta and goes to the prayer room.  123 124 96 INT. NEERJA’S HOUSE- PRAYER ROOM- EVENING Rama offers the gift to the god in the altar. With tears in her eyes she prays...

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Meri bachi ka dhyaan rakhna MAMA’S SONG ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT.COCKPIT —- EVENING
It is getting dark outside. The lights at the airport are switched on. An angry Safirini is screaming at Inzamam on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Bahut ho gaya yeh tamasha

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Generator aur crew dono aate hi honge

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Poora din nikal gaya jhooti dalile sunte, mereko pehle hi plane udha dena tha

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Plane udhaane ki sochna bhi mat, mai chup hoon kyunki tere paas 300 masoom log gqaid hain, nahi toh tere... Suddenly the radio begins to crackle. Safirini is unable to understand what Inzamam is trying to say. Safirini screams out a few hellos to Inzamam but it is as if the Radio has run out of battery. Safirini, unable to control his rage anymore, bangs the radio hard on the cock-pit and breaks it. He paces around the cock-pit, furiously for a few seconds and then bursts out in rage and with the gun in in his hands starts trashing the cockpit. Debina is cowering in fear. He trashes a few equipments and then points the gun at Debina. She thinks that her end is near. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks at her scared and helpless and changing his mind continues to trash the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noises of Safirini’s rage can be heard downstairs and people below have given up hope. Neerja, almost knowing that the terrorists patience has reached its peak gets up from her seat. She looks at the tired and exhausted passengers, all of them seem to have given up hope. Neerja takes a flask of tea and coffee and begins walking in between the passengers coaxing them to have the brew. She reaches the man sitting near the exit hatch and coaxes him to have the beverage, he is not interested. Khalil is watching her serve that man tea. The tray is on the line of the seat. Neerja, while serving him tea,

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: (smiling and ina soft tone) Iss tray ke neeche ek manual hain sir, le lijiye aur dhyaan se padhiye She swiftly looks at the emergency exit hatch next to him, he takes the manual. The man is stunned and scared as Neerja again smiles- from Khalil’s point of view it seems as if she is being air-hostessy and trying to calm the man’s nerves.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Sir please padh lijiye, aap hum sab ki jaan bacha sakte hain Neerja moves on to the other side of the seat and begins talking to the man on the other side of the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safirini has finished venting out his anger. After breathing heavily for a while he makes a decision and taking his gun, Tina to get moving downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: Chalo! Niklo yahaa se (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Debina, shivering, nervously follows his command and moves out of the cockpit. Shot- Safirini has forgotten to take the explosives laden belt.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KARACHI AIRPORT/HANGAR AREA- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Brigadier TM is giving last minute instructions to the commandoes. They are all ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debina gets down the spiral staircase followed by Safirini. Debina goes towards her friends in the business class and bursts into tears as a couple of the girls pacify her. Neerja is walking through rows and rows of mentally exhausted passengers. Safirini looks stressed and Khalil is watching him. Fahad and Mansoor are drained of energy and looks at Safirini and Khalil to come up with something soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sniper takes position.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PLANE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Neerja continues to walk. Sees the patient struggling to breathe and a worried Sanjana taking care of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another sniper focuses on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PLANE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Neerja looking around- a worried mother taking care of her two peacefully sleeping children. A Man fanning his pregnant wife trying to comfort her.  133 134 135 136 137 138 99

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KARACHI AIRPORT/HANGAR AREA- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Inzamam looking at his watch- zillions of thoughts running through his head.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PLANE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Neerja still walking - Heston is sitting on the floor taking a look at the passports that are lying around him. Safirini, Khalil and Mansoor looking nervous in the section near the galley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja still walking and through her POV - Mansoor is standing next to Heston and he looks tired too. Khalil’s red-eyes flicking from one passenger to another. Neerja passes him and goes towards the business class where a few of her colleagues are tiredly sitting. From the overhead storage Neerja removes her bag and removes a a couple of 5-star bars that Jaideep gifted her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAR/HOARDING SITE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jaideep is looking at Neerja smiling back at him through the hoarding. He is on the verge of tears as he listen to the radio broadcast through the car radio.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO BROADCAST
dialogues.text: 15 ghante se chal rahi Hijack ki paristhiti ka koi hal nahi ho paa rahaa, humaare sootron ki anusaar, militry Pan Am 73 ke andar humla karne ki tayyari kar rahi hain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja sits down heavily on a chair and is lost in thought. She is trying to fight negative thoughts from clouding her mind. She puts her hand in her jacket and removes Jaideep’s letter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lovingly she unwraps the chocolate and then removes the letter from the envelope. Taking a bite from the chocolate she begins to read the letter.

dialogues.speaker: JAIDEEP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ‘Ek chota sa ghaav bahut gehra zakham ban sakta hain aur ek choti si mulaakat jeevan bhar ka saath ban sakti hain.’ Ghaav ko zakhm mat banne do Neerja, Zindagi jeene liye hoti hain, pachtaane ke liye nahi, mai chahta hoon ki humaari choti si mulaakat jeevan bhar ka saath ban jaaye. Ab please please apne Kaka ji ki baat mat taalna. Agar unse romance nahi seekha toh kya seekha. marry me Babumoshai? PS: Kaun si film? Safar right? Neerja’s eyes tear up as she continues to chew the chocolate holding it dearly as if a ray of hope.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: (mumbles ) Aradhna you idiot She weeps

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAR/HOARDING SITE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jaideep is still listening to the radio broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO BROADCAST
dialogues.text: Nearly 100 Indians are said to be passengers and crew on Pan Am 73 and it is difficult to say when this stalemate will end. Jaideep is winding the radio cassette. Jaideep cannot control his tears and begins crying harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja is silently crying too.
Inzamam is waiting for the next move when Brigadier TM enters. He signals Inzamam, without any words, that it is time for action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sniper focuses on a window shutter that has slightly opened and he is relaying a message to Brigadier TM.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDO
dialogues.text: Sir ek terrorist ne apni window ka shutter khola hain, What is the order sir? His POV Safirini is looking through the window.

dialogues.speaker: INT. KARACHI AIRPORT/HANGAR AREA- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Brigadier TM is on the radio channel with the commando. Everyone around is waiting with bated breath.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER TM
dialogues.text: Take the shot-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commando is about slowly about to pull the trigger. Suddenly the lights in the plane go off. INT. PLANE - NIGHT. Reactions- Neerja- other air-hostesses - Khalil - Panic amongst the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDO
dialogues.text: (surprise) What the... !!! Sir!  145 146 147 148 102

dialogues.speaker: INT. KARACHI AIRPORT/HANGAR AREA- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Brigadier TM looks frustrated as the commandoes around him are anxiously awaiting orders.

dialogues.speaker: INZAMAM
dialogues.text: Auxiliary power khatm ho gayi hain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja looks worried, her mind buzzing with a million thoughts. Some of the passengers have begun to panic As she expected Khalil, Safirini and Mansoor react to the lights going off.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Military ne bilji kaat di hain, ab woh tayyari kar rahe hain plane mein aane ki Safirini unsure.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Nahi, woj jaante hain agar woh plane mein daakhil hue toh hum passenger maarna shuru kar denge Neerja is watching Khalil and Safirini talk loudly.

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: (aggressively in Arabic) Bhai jaan khalaas ab faisle ki ghadi aa chuki hain

dialogues.speaker: EXT, TARMAC
dialogues.text: Pakistani andoes—are_stealthily approaching the Seme—ofthem—are—in_the _stai an—driving—in_the— direct £ the plane so that they ca: harge side,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja’s father is stressed as he sees Mushtag on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ KHAN
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Kya? Are you sure? He listens for a while and then hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHTAQ KHAN
dialogues.text: (to Neerja’s father) Pakistani commandos plane mein jaane ki tayyari kar rahe hain

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. NEERJA’S HOUSE - PRAYER ROOM - NIGHT Rama, with folded hands, is praying to her gods. Her face tired and wrinkled with the stress of the day.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (To Mansoor) (in arabic) Mansoor Fahad ke saath peeche jao Khalil staff ko leke aage aao. Mansoor picks Heston as a human shield and walks towards Fahad. Khalil goes towards the business class area and begins roughing up the air-hostesses including Neerja. The other air-hostesses have begun to panic Neerja is trying to plead with Khalil not to do anything rash but he continues to push the air-hostesses out of the business class area in economy class. Neerja tries to go towards Safirini.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Yeh plane ki auxiliary power khatm hui hain, isse kissi ne baahar se bandh nahi kiya hain. Generator aata hi hoga, please thodi der ruko Khalil slaps Neerja and she falls away from Khalil where Jatin and the kids are seated. Passengers have begun to panic and some of them can be heard crying and shrieking. A passenger behind looks scared and is getting antsy. Neerja gets up from her seat again and Khalil points his gun towards her as if ready to shoot her when the nervous passenger gets up from his seat and runs towards the exit hatch diverting Khalil from Neerja and he fires some bullets in his direction and kills him. Safirini, Fahad and Mansoor begin firing as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safirni and Khalil are madly spraying the passengers with bullets and from behind so are Fahad and Mansoor. The passengers sitting in the front are victims while the passengers behind are screaming, shrieking, cowering and panicking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shots of a few passengers being hit by bullets- Passengers cowering and barely escaping being hit. The man next to the mother with the 2 kids is shot and the mother instinctively, almost throws her 2 sleeping children in the small space under the seat one top of the other. A scared Neerja shouts at the cowering man near the exit to open the hatch but the din of the gunshots is too much. Neerja jumps into action and jumping over some passengers reaches the exit door and opens it. The chute inflates outwards. She begins screaming for passengers to get out. The passengers near the hatch are so scared that they do not see the way out. Neerja pulls a few of them towards the door and almost pushes them out. The passengers near the hatch quickly begin to rush towards that one door. Neerja calls out to Sanjana and Tina

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Go! Mai aa jaaoongi, plane se niklo! Sanjana approaches Neerja and pulls her

dialogues.speaker: SANJANA
dialogues.text: Come !

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Sanjana, tum jaao mai baaki passenger ko chute tak laati hoon

dialogues.speaker: SANJANA
dialogues.text: Dont be silly Neerja! jaldi chalo

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Sanjana! Please! She pushes Sanjana towards the chute People begin pushing Neerja out of the way as the spray of bullets continue. On seeing the hatch open The pregnant woman’s husband is trying to tell his wife to come with him but he turns towards her and sees her eyes closed. Then looks at her face and sees that it has a bullet wound. He breaks down and cries seeing his pregnant wife dead. And while in tears gets out of the seat and rushes towards the hatch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Safirini, Khalil, Mansoor and Fahad looks merciless as their face lights up with each gunshot. The mother of the 2 children thinks it is time to make good their escape. She slowly reaches out to the children under her and suddenly her eyes widen with panic. She feels something wet in her hand. She sees blood and almost about to cry when she feels them both move. It was the blood from the man shot next to her that fell on the kids. She tells them both to stick with her and she walks out too. Neerja pushes her way through the crowd of people and escaping the bullets fizzing past her she manages to open the other door and the chute inflates out. People near that door make a break for it pushing Neerja aside. Neerja looks around through the chaos and spots the 3 kids a little further away cowering under the seats. People on the wing see the chute inflate. A couple of them are scared to jump from the wing almost 20ft down and decide to leap on the chute. One of the passengers manages to land safely on the chute. Others try the same. Some slip and slide on the wing. Some of them fall down and injure themselves but somehow find the strength to bear through that pain and get away from the plane. The mother uses all her strength to throw her 2 kids one by one on the chute. They barely manage to make it. She then tries to do the same and misses the chute and crashes to the ground. Her kids help her get up and she turns back to see the flashes of the gunshots still on. Some of them leap from the wing towards the chute. Some make it but some fall badly. Shots of Heston jumping and landing on the chute. Satish Kumar’s grandmother scared to jump but a commando is waiting down encouraging her to jump and she does. Some people landing on another person already fallen down. Utter chaos in their attempt to just get away from the carnage inside.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TARMAC- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The ambulances rush into action and the Commandoes begin helping the passengers into them.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PLANE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Neerja pushes through the crowd of people rushing to make their way out of the plane. Some of them are bleeding because of the bullet injuries. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Neerja pushes her way through the crowd. Most of the people have managed to rush out through the two open hatches but Neerja’s eyes are on the 3 kids scared and crying under their seats. Fahad removes a grenade from his pocket and is about to throw it in the centre of the plane from where the passengers have escaped when Mansoor stops him.

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Nahi Fahad nahi, agar humne iss bomb ko phek diya toh hum bhi mar jaayenge

dialogues.speaker: FAHAD
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Hum mar chuke hai Mansoor, aage khaai peeche kua hain, yahaan se bach nikle toh baahar militry maar degi Mansoor looks at Fahad realizing that is clearly the end, his eyes fill with tears, he shakes his head Mansoor is strongly holding Fahad’s hand and stopping him from throwing the grenade and Fahad is trying to fight him. ON THE OTHER SIDE. Neerja crawls low over dead-bodies and reaches the 3 kids. They are scared to come out.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Chalo, be brave now, for me. The boy holds Neerja’s outstretched hand. And the 2 other girls follow. The gun-shots have stopped and the plane is almost empty. Few injured people are groaning for help and struggling to get out. Neerja is caught in a dilemma whether to help the kids or the injured passengers but chooses the kids over them. Khalil watches Neerja attempting to take the kids to safety. He fires a few rounds tying to hit her but the injured passenger behind is hit. Safirini feels under his pathani and remembers that he forgot the belt in the cockpit her runs towards the spiral stairs and upwards. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE.
dialogues.text: Fahad and Mansoor have started almost fighting with each other with the grenade in their hand. Fahad punches Mansoor but Mansoor is not letting go.

dialogues.speaker: MANSOOR
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Militry maaregi nahi, giraftar karegi, hum bach sakte hain Another punch, the grenade falls from Fahad’s hands and rolls away from them. Fahad is angry and takes out the knife in his back-pocket and stabs Mansoor. ON THE OTHER SIDE. Khalil comes running towards the hatch as Neerja is coaxing the kids to slide down the chute.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Go go, I’m right behind you. Woh aunty[pointing to a Sanjana at the end of the slide] tumhe catch kar lengi. Just then they are startled by Khalil’s menacing voice. Neerja looks up and sees him holding his gun at her. Neerja protectively shields the 3 kids behind her back. Khalil is about to fire at her when suddenly out of no where, Neerja pounces on Khalil angrily. He is taken by surprise. Neerja grabs a hold of his gun and tries to wrestle it out of his hands. Neerja is using all her force and Khalil slaps her hard a couple if time and tries to push her away but Neerja is not letting go. In the midst of the scuffle a few shots are fired and finally Neerja manages to snatch the gun and fires a shot at Khalil injuring him as he falls backwards. Neerja turns around to face the scared kids she smiles at them as they look at her in shock. We can now see that Neerja has taken the two shots fired during the scuffle. Neerja smiles and tells the kids that she is right behind them and tells them to slide. As they slide down she winces in pain. Just then Safirini comes screaming wearing no pathani kurta but just the explosive laden belt.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (screaming) Fahad-Mansoor- Khalil- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks around sees Khalil injured. Looks at Fahad and sees a blood soaked Fahad standing atop an injured Mansoor. Safirini’s face reveals the failure of the mission. Neerja watches the 3 kids slide down and Sanjana puts them in the ambulance and gets in as well. She looks around to see if anybody else needs help but all around her are dead bodies. Safirini stands in front of them, he is wearing the explosives belt, he looks down at the belt and looks at Fahad

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Goli chala Fahad hesitates looking frightened. He holds his gun down.

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) Miltry ke haath marne se behtar hain hum apne haathon mar jaaye

dialogues.speaker: SAFIRINI
dialogues.text: (in arabic) chala goli. Iss tamashe ko khatam kar de Fahad comes closer and takes a shot, he is about to shoot at Safirini when suddenly his feet is yanked and he trips causing the shot to miss the belt but only injure Safirini. It is Neerja near the hatch who pulled Fahad's leg. Neerja then rolls down the chute as blood marks spread a trail of her fall. She lands hard or the tarmac. Fahad is near the grenade that had fallen during his fight with Mansoor. There is a blast in the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two stretcher-bearers come rushing towards Neerja lying in a pool of blood. She is grimacing in pain as they put her on the stretcher and go sprinting towards the ambulance nearby.

dialogues.speaker: INT. AMBULANCE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Neerja is bleeding, the 3 kids and Sanjana are standing close by along with a few more injured passengers and the stretcher-bearers crowding the ambulance. Neerja beckons Jatin.

dialogues.speaker: NEERJA
dialogues.text: Jatin, mera ek kaam karoge

dialogues.speaker: INT. PLANE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Inzamam is in the plane. Sad, distraught and almost in tears. His eyes scan around and through his POV we see the aftermath of the Hijack in the plane. Blood. Carnage. Destruction. He looks at the roof destroyed because of the grenade blast. A dove comes and sits on the edge and then flies off. Inzamam finds it hard to control his tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brigadier TM watches as the military handcuffs the injured Safirini is taken into the vehicle. The other injured terrorists are carried on stretchers as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inzamam, crying now, as he sees the dead bodies- Imran Ali the radio engineer, Anand Parekh - with many other dead people in the plane-  166 167 168 111

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAR/HOARDING SITE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jaideep is a broken man as he hears the news of the break in gunshots, apprehension of the terrorists and the death of a few passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaideep’s love letter is seen floating around in the breeze and escapes through the hatch door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. NEERJA'S HOUSE- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The irritating monotone of the DD soundbar is heard. Aneesh is almost in tears as he is talking on the phone. Akhil is standing restless next to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANEESH
dialogues.text: meri behen Neerja Bhanot uss plane pe hain, I need to know if she is safe. Please don’t put me on hold again. Akhil takes the phone from Aneesh

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello what is your name? Aap lagaataar hume hold pe daale jaa rahe hain, aapko pataa bhi hum pe kya beet rahi hain? I want to know the status of Purser Neerja Bhanot. No. I will not hold. Mai case kar doonga aap sab pe, Hello? Akhil angrily bangs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: AKHIL
dialogues.text: (to Aneesh) Aneesh, ro kya rahaa hain budhu, Neerja ko kuch nahi hoga, jaa mamma ke liye paani leke aa, mai phir se try karta hoon Akhil takes the receiver and calls again. It is clear that he is on the verge of breakdown as well. Rama is blankly staring at the Color TV with the Colorbar on it. She is rocking back and forth and mumbling to herself (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Bilkul kuch ni hona meri lado ko. Sab theek hoga, ghar aa jaayegi raat tak, karachi toh paas hi hain. Ghar aa jaayegi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neerja’s father is on the phone with Pakistan dawn office.

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
dialogues.text: Any news?

dialogues.speaker: PAKISTANI JOURNALIST
dialogues.text: Sir bahut confusion hain yahaan, shanakht ki koi gunjaaish nahi, please thoda waqt dijiye hume, kuch maaloom hote hi mai aapko khud phone kar doonga

dialogues.speaker: HARISH
